DOCNAME: CASE OF VILHO ESKELINEN AND OTHERS v. FINLAND
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1 (length of proceedings);No violation of Art. 6-1 (lack of a hearing);Violation of Art. 13;No violation of P1-1 alone or in conjunction with Art. 14;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - domestic and Convention proceedings
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Egbert Myjer;Françoise Tulkens;Giovanni Bonello;Javier Borrego Borrego;Jean-Paul Costa;Kristaq Traja;Lech Garlicki;Luzius Wildhaber;Matti Pellonpää;Mindia Ugrekhelidze;Nicolas Bratza;Peer Lorenzen
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in PERSON and PERSON .

CARDINAL . The first CARDINAL applicants and the late Mr PERSON worked in LOC . Under a collective agreement concluded in DATE , they were entitled to a remote - area allowance , which was added to their salaries as a bonus for working in a remote part of the country . The amounts of the allowance were calculated on the basis of a given area ’s remoteness . By a collective agreement concluded on DATE , the remote - area allowance was abolished . This would have resulted in a reduction of the salary payable to civil servants whose duty station was PERSON . In order to prevent such a reduction , the collective agreement granted them DATE individual wage supplements from DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE GPE was incorporated into LOC by a decision of ORG ( sisäasiainministeriö , inrikesministeriet ) . Following the incorporation , the ORG duty station changed . They also lost their individual wage supplements and the length of their commute allegedly increased by CARDINAL QUANTITY per day as they had to travel from GPE to GPE .
CARDINAL . According to the applicants , following their request of CARDINAL DATE to that effect , ORG ( läänin poliisijohto , länspolisledningen ) promised that their loss would be compensated .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , at the request of ORG , submitted a request for authorisation for the payment of DATE individual wage supplements , amounting to CARDINAL and MONEY ( ORG ) ( DATE ) per person , to those police officers and other personnel whose duty station had been changed from GPE to GPE . The request referred to an allegedly analogous case ( the PERSON case ) in which ORG ( valtiovarainministeriö , finansministeriet ) had granted a request for individual wage supplements on DATE . On DATE ORG replied that it could not grant such authorisation . It gave no reasons for its refusal .
CARDINAL . On DATE competence to decide on wage supplements in respect of local police forces was transferred to ORG ( lääninhallitus , länsstyrelsen ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged an application requesting that they be compensated for their loss . They referred to the above decision in the PERSON case . They also relied on the principle of equality as laid down in LAW then in force ( NORP hallitusmuoto , NORP för GPE ; PERSON no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . DATE , on DATE , the request was rejected by ORG . It reasoned :

“ The civil servants of the former LOC ... have ... requested compensation for the losses arising from the incorporation of police districts , in response to which ORG , endorsing the request , submitted documents to ORG . By a letter of DATE , ORG recommended to ORG the retroactive payment from DATE of individual wage supplements to those civil servants whose duty station , after the incorporation , is ORG .
By a letter of DATE , [ ORG ] informed ORG that it had found that it could not grant the request .

Following the [ ORG ] decision , competence to decide on individual wage supplements was transferred to ORG . On DATE , in a negotiation meeting held by ORG at which the applicants were represented by PERSON , it was noted that negotiations were pending with regard to ORG in GPE , which was a corresponding case . As [ ORG ] , which had the relevant competence , had already decided the claims concerning LOC , it was concluded that , on grounds of fairness , the decision in PERSON would be adhered to in GPE were it to depart from the view of ORG . ORG rejected the application and the decision was upheld by ORG . No new grounds have been presented in the letter of DATE , or in PERSON [ further and ] separate claim of CARDINAL DATE , to support the claims which have already been decided [ by ORG ] .

ORG has not learned of any positive decisions regarding compensation in corresponding cases as regards the incorporation of police districts anywhere in the country following the above - mentioned [ ORG ] decision .

In DATE , when the incorporation took place , ORG lacked competence to make any binding promises as regards the compensation of costs . Its view had been shown through its support of the application .

ORG , using its discretion and basing itself on the earlier decision by the competent authority , considers that the decision has acquired a certain res judicata effect . Emphasising the principles of equality and fairness , ORG also bases itself on the prevalent practice throughout the country . ”

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , in DATE CARDINAL of the applicants lodged a complaint with the Chancellor of ORG ( oikeuskansleri , justitiekanslern ) who , in his decision of DATE , drew attention to the fact that the applicants had still not received any answer to their application .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed against ORG decision and requested an oral hearing which , they asserted , would make it possible to establish the facts of the case , in particular that a promise had been made by ORG . ORG ( lääninoikeus , länsrätten ) received replies to the appeal from ORG and ORG Attorney ( lääninasiamies , länsombudet ) , and these were communicated to the applicants for comment .
CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE , ORG reasoned :
“ Rectification of wage increases affecting pensions falls outside ORG competence .

It is not necessary to receive oral testimony from the parties as regards ORG of ORG promises concerning the incorporation of police districts , or on how the case has been otherwise handled , in order to clarify the case .

In its letter of CARDINAL DATE , ORG proposed to ORG that LOC be incorporated into LOC from DATE [ in fact , ORG recommended payment , not incorporation ] and that the inconvenience caused by the change of duty station be compensated in the form of a wage supplement of ORG CARDINAL to CARDINAL per month , retroactively from DATE . In its letter of CARDINAL DATE , ORG considered that it could not grant the request . Negotiations were held between ORG of ORG and ORG ] on DATE and between ORG of ORG and the ORG representative on DATE .
Pursuant to LAW ( as amended on DATE ) , ORG has competence to decide on wage supplements in respect of ... civil servants in the local police forces .

ORG must be considered to have examined the applicants’ ... submission dated DATE as a rectification request , referred to in LAW of ORG . The rectification request has been lodged within the time laid down by section PERSON ) of ORG , if calculated from ORG decision of DATE .

In DATE ORG of ORG lacked competence to give any binding promises pertaining to compensation . Competence to decide the matter lay at that time with ORG , which in its letter of CARDINAL DATE had stated that it considered that it could not accede to the request . Since DATE ORG has had competence to decide on the wages of local police .

ORG has in its decision , subject to appeal , based itself on the decision by the former competent authority and on the fact that after DATE no compensation had been awarded to personnel in other cases in which incorporation had taken place . The decision is therefore based on the prevalent practice at that time in the entire country . The decision can not be considered unreasonable in those circumstances . It has been possible to dismiss the request for rectification . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed further , requesting an oral hearing and emphasising that similar wage supplements had been granted to personnel from other police districts in corresponding situations . They relied , for example , on a decision of DATE by ORG , granting a police officer an individual wage supplement from DATE following incorporation of ORG into LOC .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( korkein hallinto - oikeus , högsta förvaltningsdomstolen ) , having received observations from ORG and the ORG Attorney and having communicated them to the applicants for comment , upheld the lower court ’s decision . It reasoned :
“ ORG has examined the case .

The promises made by ORG of ORG as regards compensation for costs arising from the incorporation of police districts have no legal relevance to the case . Thus , the holding of an oral hearing is manifestly unnecessary . Accordingly , ORG , having regard to section CARDINAL ) of LAW , refuses [ the appellants’ ] request for an oral hearing .

In their letter of DATE , [ the appellants ] requested compensation in the form of individual wage supplements of costs arising from the incorporation of their police district . On DATE competence to decide on wages in respect of local police forces was transferred to ORG pursuant to section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the State Collective Agreement Decree ( as amended on DATE ) .

[ The appellants ] have no statutory right to the individual wage supplement in question . ORG has not overstepped its margin of appreciation . ORG decision is not in breach of the law . Therefore , ORG , having regard to section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of ORG , finds that there is no reason to amend the outcome of ORG decision , which accordingly remains final . ”
CARDINAL . The implementing instruction of CARDINAL DATE on the application of the collective agreement with regard to the payment of a cold - area allowance to civil servants provided :

“ A civil servant working ( before DATE ) in a municipality not covered by the new collective agreement is entitled to an individual wage supplement ... as long as he or she is working in the municipality giving rise to an entitlement to such an allowance . Where a civil servant entitled to an individual wage supplement is ordered , temporarily or as a substitute , to perform the duties of another civil servant , or where his or her duty station is transferred to a municipality in which the previous remote - area allowance has not been paid , the said civil servant will not be paid the individual wage supplement during the period he or she is performing those other duties because , in order to receive the wage supplement , the civil servant has to perform his or her duties in a municipality giving rise to entitlement to the wage supplement . ”

According to the applicants , this instruction was not relevant to the present case , in that it allegedly concerned only temporary transfers , whereas the transfer of the applicants’ place of duty had been of a permanent nature .

CARDINAL . In its request of CARDINAL DATE , ORG referred to an allegedly analogous case in which ORG had on DATE granted a request for individual wage supplements following the incorporation of LOC into that of GPE ( the PERSON case ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused a request for compensation for commuting costs lodged by a civil servant whose duty station had changed following the incorporation of the LOC into that of the NORP and LOC . The decision was upheld by ORG and ORG on DATE and DATE respectively .

CARDINAL . By a decision of DATE , ORG granted a police officer a cold - area allowance at level CARDINAL plus an individual wage supplement compensating for the difference between level CARDINAL ( Valtimo ) and level CARDINAL ( ORG ) of the cold - area allowance following the incorporation of ORG into LOC ( the ORG case ) .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the Administrative Judicial Procedure Act ( hallintolainkäyttölaki , förvaltningsprocesslagen ; PERSON no . ORG ) provides that an oral hearing must be held if requested by a private party . An oral hearing may however be dispensed with if a party ’s request is ruled inadmissible or immediately dismissed or if an oral hearing would be clearly unnecessary due to the nature of the case or other circumstances .

CARDINAL . The explanatory report on the Government Bill ( no . CARDINAL ) for the enactment of LAW examines the right to an oral hearing as provided by LAW and the possibility in administrative matters to dispense with the hearing when it would be clearly unnecessary , as stated in section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the said LAW . It notes that an oral hearing contributes to a focused and immediate procedure but since it does not always bring any added value , it must be ensured that the flexibility and cost - effectiveness of the administrative procedure is not undermined . An oral hearing is to be held when it is necessary for the clarification of the issues and the hearing can be considered beneficial for the case as a whole .
CARDINAL . The international law and practice from which the ORG sought guidance in PERSON v. GPE ( [ ORG ] , no . CARDINAL , ORG CARDINALVIII ) has been outlined in that judgment ( see § § DATE ) .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of LAW , proclaimed on DATE , on the right to an effective remedy and a fair trial , provides :

“ Everyone whose rights and freedoms guaranteed by the law of the Union are violated has the right to an effective remedy before a tribunal in compliance with the conditions laid down in this Article .

Everyone is entitled to a fair and public hearing within a reasonable time by an independent and impartial tribunal previously established by law . Everyone shall have the possibility of being advised , defended and represented .
Legal aid shall be made available to those who lack sufficient resources in so far as such aid is necessary to ensure effective access to justice . ”

CARDINAL . The Explanations relating to LAW , originally prepared under the authority of ORG which drafted the LAW and finally integrated in LAW establishing a LAW for LOC , do not have equal authority to the LAW . However , they are a “ valuable tool of interpretation intended to clarify the provisions of LAW . They read as follows ( extract ) :
“ The second paragraph [ of LAW ] corresponds to Article CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the ORG which reads as follows :

‘ In the determination of his civil rights and obligations or of any criminal charge against him , everyone is entitled to a fair and public hearing within a reasonable time by an independent and impartial tribunal established by law . Judgment shall be pronounced publicly but the press and public may be excluded from all or part of the trial in the interests of morals , public order or national security in a NORP society , where the interests of juveniles or the protection of the private life of the parties so require , or to the extent strictly necessary in the opinion of the court in special circumstances where publicity would prejudice the interests of ORG

In Union law , the right to a fair hearing is not confined to disputes relating to civil law rights and obligations . That is one of the consequences of the fact that the ORG is a community based on the rule of law as stated by ORG , ‘ PERSON v. ORG ( judgment of DATE , [ DATE ] ECR CARDINAL ) . Nevertheless , in all respects other than their scope , the guarantees afforded by the ORG apply in a similar way to the ORG . ”

It follows that LAW , in the context of ORG law , is not confined to civil rights and obligations or to criminal matters within the meaning of Article CARDINAL of the Convention . In this respect the Charter codified existing case - law of ORG of ORG ( see PERSON v. Chief Constable of ORG , Case CARDINAL/CARDINAL , [ DATE ] ECR CARDINAL , referred to in paragraph CARDINAL below ) .
